messages.subject: Re:Court ruling that homeschooling not constitutional
messages.msgSnippet: ******* Did you hear that an appellate judge in L.A. just ruled that homeschooling is not a constitutional right and that Californians must have a teaching
messages.messageBody:
*******
Did you hear that an appellate judge in L.A. just ruled that homeschooling is not a constitutional right and that Californians must have a teaching credential to teach their children?!

******

Since it's a California issue and not related to unschooling, you might want to join one of the California homeschooling yahoo groups to discuss and read about this issue. The HSC (HomeSchool Association of California) is very active on the subject right now. The addy is: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/CA-Homeschooling-HSC/




Meghan

I can create what I can imagine. ~ Charlene Kingston


---------------------------------

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Court ruling that homeschooling not constitutional
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Did you hear that an appellate judge in L.A. just ruled that homeschooling is not a constitutional right and that Californians must have a teaching
messages.messageBody:
-=-Did you hear that an appellate judge in L.A. just ruled that
homeschooling is not a constitutional right and that Californians
must have a teaching credential to teach their children?!-=-

If you're on another list that's more into politics and laws, that
would be a better place to take this. It's not about how people
learn, and California law has never had "homeschooling" legal
anyway. It's a local issue. It will be taken care of in California.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
